snippet: Investigating judges accused the Americans of manipulating the Egyptian political process and improperly collecting information to send home to the United States.
abstract: Prime Minister Kamal el-Ganzouri vows that Egypt will defy Washington’s pressure to halt criminal prosecutions of 19 Americans as investigating judges accuse them of manipulating the Egyptian political process and improperly collecting information to send home to the United States; brushes aside the increasingly forceful warnings from President Obama and Congressional leaders that the United States could withhold $1.55 billion in annual aid to Egypt over the case.
lead_paragraph: Investigating judges accused the Americans of manipulating the Egyptian political process and improperly collecting information to send home to the United States.

headline.seo: Egypt’s Premier Vows to Prosecute 19 Americans
headline.main: Egypt’s Premier Vows Not to Yield in Prosecuting 19 Americans
headline.print_headline: Egypt’s Premier Vows Not to Yield in Prosecuting 19 Americans
